verses.roman:
avanijyāṅghri-yugalam
āsīt ślokyo balir mahān
aiśvaryam atulaṁ lebhe
gatiṁ caikāntināṁ tu yā

synonyms: avanijya—bathing; aṅghri-yugalam—the two feet; āsīt—became; ślokyaḥ—glorious; baliḥ—King Bali; mahān—the great; aiśvaryam—power; atulam—unequaled; lebhe—he achieved; gatīm—the destination; ca—and; ekāntinām—of the unalloyed devotees of the Lord; tu—indeed; yā—which.
translation: By bathing Your feet, the exalted Bali Mahārāja attained not only glorious fame and unequaled power but also the final destination of pure devotees.
